text: Regional parliaments of Russia are the legislative/parliamentary bodies of power in the regions of Russia (Republics, Krais, Oblasts, Autonomous okrugs and Federal Cities of Moscow and St. Petersburg), which have different names, often collectively referred to in the media as regional parliaments. The federal structure of Russia includes 83 regional parliaments. The biggest regional parliament is the State Assembly of Bashkortostan which consists of 120 deputies. The smallest one is the Assembly of Deputies of the Nenets Autonomous Okrug which consists of 11 deputies. Title Number Legislative Assembly 28 Regional (Oblast) Duma 21 State Assembly 5 State Council 5 Assembly of Deputies 3 Board of Deputies 3 People's Assembly 3 Khural 3 Parliament 3 State Duma 2 Others 7 == Parties in Each Parliament == In the table are marked in bold parliaments, elected solely by the proportional system.
